sentences.en: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.
sentences.cn: 所有主要的经济指标都表明贸易情况正在改善。

sentences.en: First , a sound market operation to reflect the state of indicator system.
sentences.cn: 一是健全反映市场运行状况的指标体系.

sentences.en: Gold prices are often seen as an indicator of inflation.
sentences.cn: 黃金价格常常被看作是通货膨胀的指标.

sentences.en: His left - hand / right - hand indicator is flashing.
sentences.cn: 他的左[右]信号灯在闪动.

sentences.en: His left - hand indicator is flashing.
sentences.cn: 他左手边的转向灯正在闪亮.

sentences.en: It is vital to know the accurate components of an indicator.
sentences.cn: 知道有关指标是由哪些成分组成也非常重要.

sentences.en: Litmus paper can be used as an indicator of the presence of acid in a solution.
sentences.cn: 石蕊试纸可用以测试溶液是否含酸.

sentences.en: Presently, Peroxidase is employed as indicator for blanching treatments of vegetables.
sentences.cn: 目前蔬菜的热烫终点以过氧化物酶作为指示剂来确定.

sentences.en: The indicator that is set when an operator starts a WSU program.
sentences.cn: 操作员启动工作站公用程序(WSU)时设置的指示器.

sentences.en: The number of indicator lamps in conventional dashboards is increasing.
sentences.cn: 在常规仪表板上指示灯的数目不断增加.

sentences.en: The number of wells is a fair indicator of the demand for water.
sentences.cn: 水井的数量能较准确地反映水需求量的大小。

sentences.en: The range is usually limited to the full - scale deflection of the indicator.
sentences.cn: 量程通常以指针的全分度偏转为限.

sentences.en: The reset button is for resetting the light indicator after tripping.
sentences.cn: 指示器被锁定.按下复位按钮使灯光指示器恢复到正常状态.

sentences.en: Upon the addition of a good starch indicator a blue solution results.
sentences.cn: 加入好的淀粉溶液指示剂,这时溶液变成兰色.

sentences.en: We can use an indicator with a pointer or a continuous recording device.
sentences.cn: 我们可以使用有指南针的指示器,或是连续记录的装置.

sentences.en: Working mode indicator should be provided on the cabinet door.
sentences.cn: 柜门上应提供工作状态指示.

words.tran_cn: 陈述语气；陈述语气的动词形式
[微][试剂][计][电][电子][机]指示器；指示剂；指示符；压力计

phrases.tran_cn: 指示剂；指示生物；生物学指标
方向指示器；方向标；转向标；航向指示器；中心指示器
滞后指标；迟滞指标；拉后指标
绩效指标；业绩指标，成绩衡量指标
功率指示计；[计]电源指示器

trans.tran_cn: 指示器，[化]指示剂，指示者，指标
trans.tran_en: something that can be regarded as a sign of something else
